verbs.description: The pendulum [V: has] swung decisively in favor of Donald Trump “ nixing ” the Iran nuclear deal at the earliest possible opportunity . The operative question is : what comes next ?

[ARG1: The pendulum] has [V: swung] [ARGM-MNR: decisively] [ARGM-ADV: in favor of Donald Trump “ nixing ” the Iran nuclear deal at the earliest possible opportunity] . The operative question is : what comes next ?

The pendulum has swung decisively in favor of [ARG0: Donald Trump] “ [V: nixing] ” [ARG1: the Iran nuclear deal] [ARGM-TMP: at the earliest possible opportunity] . The operative question is : what comes next ?
The pendulum has swung decisively in favor of Donald Trump “ nixing ” the Iran nuclear deal at the earliest possible opportunity . [ARG1: The operative question] [V: is] : [ARG2: what comes next] ?

The pendulum has swung decisively in favor of Donald Trump “ nixing ” the Iran nuclear deal at the earliest possible opportunity . The operative question is : [ARG1: what] [V: comes] [ARGM-TMP: next] ?
